https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/d2k3jLed4qDq3d2pznYeMNcCDgg.jpg Alan Turing, the father of modern computing, worked at Bletchley Park to crack Germany's Enigma encryption device. He later fell victim to persecution in his own country for being a homosexual. He finally died of poisoning under mysterious circumstances. Decoding Alan Turing
